sense.name: a cruciform, an upright post with a transverse beam
sense.examples: The sculpture consisted of several metal crosses joined at oblique angles to each other. The cross was a device used for execution by the ancient Romans.

sense.name: a Christian religious object symbolizing the crucifixion of Jesus
sense.examples: She wears a gold cross around her neck on a chain. They assumed it was a Christian cemetery because of all the crosses. They took Jesus down from the cross. The bishop led the procession, carrying a cross.

sense.name: a 2D mark of short intersecting lines
sense.examples: Put a cross in the boxes next to the items you'd like to order. Mary scored the top pie crust with crosses before putting it into the oven.

sense.name: any cause or source of great suffering
sense.examples: Her child's illness was a cross she had to bear for years. That failure will be his cross to bear and his alone.

sense.name: organism that is a genetic hybrid
sense.examples: A mule is a cross between a horse and a donkey. This rose is a successful cross of an heirloom variety and a more modern one. These new grain crosses are more resistant to drought and disease.

sense.name: the quality of having mixed traits, a compromise
sense.examples: The system is a cross between a monorail and a conventional railway. Their form of government is a strange cross of a monarchy and free market economics. Spoon bread is sort of a cross between a baked bread and a pudding. The film was a cross between The GodFather and Star Wars.

sense.name: the act of doing genetic hybridization
sense.examples: The cross of flowers to produce new hybrids takes money and years of experimentation. The cross of a fly with a man occurred by accident in the movie The Fly.

sense.name: transverse motion across a space
sense.examples: The villain's cross to stage left should happen just after the hero's entrance at stage right. The boxer countered the blow with a cross with his right glove.

sense.name: religious invocation for a blessing by a Christian
sense.examples: The priest made the sign of the cross. The nuns all made a sign of the cross during the plane's take-off.

sense.name: a decorative cruciform medal of valor
sense.examples: He received some cross from the English queen for his valor in battle. The knights were awarded crosses by their king.
